p: Bonducellpin D from Caesalpinia bonduc ( Fig. 7B) showed high binding affinity (−9.28 kcal/mol) because its interaction is stabilized by four hydrogen bonds with Glu166 and Thr190 together with hydrophobic interactions established with eight residues. Moreover, Bonducellpin D exhibited a broad-spectrum inhibitory potential against SARS-CoV Mpro and MERS-CoV Mpro [133].
